Community Edition - [[LGPL]] |website = [http://www.logicaldoc.com www.logicaldoc.com] |released = |latest release version = 6.7 {{cite web |url=http://wiki.logicaldoc.com/wiki/Release_notes_for_LogicalDOC_6.7 |title=Release notes for LogicalDOC 6.7 |author= |date=5 April 2013 |website=http://wiki.logicaldoc.com/ |publisher=LogicalDOC |accessdate=31 May 2013}} |latest release date = {{Start date and age|df=yes|2013|04|10}} |latest preview version = |latest preview date = |programming language = [[Java (programming language)|Java]], [[AJAX]] enabled | language = [[#Languages|Multiple languages]] }} '''LogicalDOC''' is an [[free software|Free/Libre]] [[document management system]] that is designed to handle and share documents within an organization. LogicalDOC is a content repository, with [[Lucene]] indexing, [[jBPM]] workflow, and a set of automatic import procedures. The system was developed using [[Java platform|Java]] technology. == History == In 2006 two developers with experience in commercial [[J2EE]] products decided to start a business called Logical Objects, with the mission to maintain and evolve the Open Source project Contineo.{{cite web |url=http://contineo.sourceforge.net/ |title=Contineo |author= |website=sourceforge |accessdate=31 May 2013}} After one year, Logical Objects decided to branch the old project and to start a completely new product called LogicalDOC. In mid-2008, the first release of LogicalDOC was made available at SourceForge.{{cite web |url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/logicaldoc/ |title=LogicalDOC Document Management - DMS |author= |website=sourceforge |accessdate=31 May 2013}} The first release was numbered 3.6{{cite web |url=http://www.theserverside.com/discussions/thread.tss?thread_id=51275 |title=LogicalDOC - Document Management, DMS version 3.6 released |last=Gasparini |first=Alessandro |date=20 October 2008 |website=TheServerSide |publisher=TechTarget |accessdate=31 May 2013}} in order to continue the numeration from the old project. In the 2010 LogicalDOC won the [[Infoworld Bossie Awards]]{{cite web |url=http://www.infoworld.com/d/open-source/bossie-awards-2010-the-best-open-source-applications-150¤t=8&last=1#slideshowTop |title=Bossie Awards 2010: The best open source applications |last1=Binstock |first1=Andrew |last2=Dineley |first2=Doug |last3=Borck |first3=James R. |last4=Heller |first4=Martin |last5=Mobley |first5=High |date=25 August 2010 |website=Infoworld |accessdate=31 May 2013}} in category: best open source applications. == License == LogicalDOC source code is distributed under GNU LGPLv3.{{cite web |url=http://opensource.org/licenses/lgpl-3.0.html |title=The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 3.0 (LGPL-3.0) |author= |date=29 June 2007 |website=Open Source Initiative |accessdate=31 May 2013}} == Usage == LogicalDOC is a web-based document management application, so a web browser is needed to use it. Current web browsers that have been tested for compatibility with Logical Doc include: [[Firefox]], [[Internet Explorer]], [[Safari]], [[Google Chrome]]. The web interface is built using [[Google Web Toolkit]]. == Architecture == LogicalDOC is developed using Java technology based on [[J2SE]] standards and the Tomcat application server. Therefore it can be installed and executed on various platforms ([[GNU/Linux]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Mac OS X]]) The LogicalDOC architecture is based on the following technologies: * [[Apache Tomcat|Apache_Tomcat]] Application Server * [[Java (programming language)|Java]] J2SE (JDK 1.6 or higher) * [[Google Web Toolkit|GWT]] (Google Web Toolkit - Ajax) * [[Lucene]] * [[Spring Framework]] Due to its lightweight architecture, LogicalDOC can work on a wide set of devices and can be used to implement Cloud/SaaS document management. Data can be stored in a RDBMS ([[MySQL]], [[Oracle Database|Oracle]], [[PostgreSQL]], etc.) == General features == A [[document management]] system manages personal documents or business documentation, making it easier to find a previous document version. It enables searching by content, using document content indexing. LogicalDOC has currently been localized in 15 languages. LogicalDOC can be set up to support distinct full-text indexes for each supported language in order to apply specific indexing algorithms tailored to a particular language or variant. * [[Document Management]] * Document revisioning (minor and major revisions) * [[Document imaging|Image Management]] * Repository access via [[WebDAV]] and [[Web API]] * [[jBPM]] workflow * [[Lucene]] search * Multi-language support * Multi-platform support ([[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[GNU/Linux]], [[Mac OS X]]) * Browser-based GUI ([[Internet Explorer]], [[Mozilla Firefox|Firefox]], [[Google Chrome]], [[Safari_(web_browser)|Safari]]) * Desktop integration with [[Microsoft Office]] and [[Microsoft Outlook]] * [[Computer cluster|Clustering]] support * Pluggable [[authentication]]: [[LDAP]] or [[Active Directory]] * Multiple [[Database]] support: [[MySQL]], [[PostgreSQL]], [[Oracle database|Oracle]], [[Microsoft SQL Server]] * Documents full preview * Integrated OCR and [[Barcode]] recognition * Integrated TWAIN scanner support * Clustering ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[Document Management]] * [[List of content management systems]] * [[List of collaborative software]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.logicaldoc.com LogicalDOC Website] {{DEFAULTSORT:LogicalDOC}} [[Category:Java platform software]] [[Category:Document management systems]] [[Category:Free groupware]] [[Category:Free business software]]
